sentences.en: "You're wrong, quite wrong!" Henry cried out, suddenly excited.
sentences.cn: “你错了，大错特错！”亨利突然激动地大喊道。

sentences.en: Excited voices were shouting that the road was blocked by soldiers.
sentences.cn: 有人气愤地喊道马路被士兵封锁了。

sentences.en: He couldn't get to sleep because he was too excited.
sentences.cn: 他不能入睡,因为他太兴奋了.

sentences.en: He was getting excited just thinking about the trip.
sentences.cn: 一想到那次旅行他就兴奋.

sentences.en: He was very excited, and it was long before he calmed down.
sentences.cn: 他很激动, 心情久久不能平静.

sentences.en: He's still excited because of the newness of the position.
sentences.cn: 他因为新谋得这职位仍然感到兴奋.

sentences.en: Huh. What are you so excited about?
I don't think there's any reason to get excited about inflation.
sentences.cn: 我认为大可不必为通货膨胀而心烦。

sentences.en: I'm very excited about the possibility of playing for England's first team.
sentences.cn: 想到可能为英格兰首屈一指的球队效力，我非常兴奋。

sentences.en: Naturally these comings and goings excited some curiosity.
sentences.cn: 所发生的这些事自然激起了某种好奇。

sentences.en: Now, now, boys and girls, don't get so excited!
sentences.cn: 好了, 好了, 同学们, 别这么激动!

sentences.en: Right now I'm feeling very excited.
Steve flies home tomorrow – we’re all really excited.
sentences.cn: 史蒂夫明天坐飞机回家——我们都非常激动。

sentences.en: The food was nothing to get excited about (= not very good or special ).
sentences.cn: 食物很一般，没什么特别。

sentences.en: The king's cruelty excited the people to rise against him.
sentences.cn: 那个国王的残酷激起了人民起来反对他.

sentences.en: They were so excited that they kissed and kissed again.
sentences.cn: 他们激动得一次又一次地亲吻.

sentences.en: When angry or excited, however, he could be wild, profane, and terrifying.
sentences.cn: 但愤怒或激动的时候，他也会发狂、会骂人、令人生畏。

words.tran_cn: 易激动的；易兴奋的；易怒的
令人兴奋的；使人激动的
[生理] 兴奋性，应激性；可激发性
兴奋；刺激；令人兴奋的事物

trans.tran_cn: 激动的，紧张不安的，性兴奋的
trans.tran_en: happy, interested, or hopeful because something good has happened or will happen
happy, interested, or hopeful because something good has happened or will happen
